Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery hydria or amphora; exterior, pale slip: trace of black moulded ridge at turn to neck; geese to right (neck and head of first; head missing of second; added red on wing and added white dots on feathers; trace of wing feathers and tail feathers of third); below, handle root flanked by vertical line and red-black rosette to its right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

In pencil 'cf BM Kunze'. Joins British Museum 1888,0601.582, which von Bothmer, quoted by Venit 1984, 149, would attribute to Sophilos, despite the atypical single breast line on the geese. See Emil Kunze, Ath.Mitt. 59 (1934) 96, n.1 and Beil. X 1.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2207)
